context: A set of robots use different colors to paint patterns in floor tiles. The robots can move around the floor tiles in four directions (up, down, left and right). Robots paint with one color at a time, but can change their spray guns to any available color. However, robots can only paint the tile that is in front (up) and behind (down) them, and once a tile has been painted no robot can stand on it. Robots need to paint a grid with black and white, where the cell color is alternated always. There are 12 tiles and 2 robots. The tiles locations are: tile_11 is to the right of tile_10, tile_5 is to the right of tile_4, tile_3 is to the right of tile_2, tile_8 is to the right of tile_7, tile_12 is to the right of tile_11, tile_9 is to the right of tile_8, tile_6 is to the right of tile_5, and tile_2 is to the right of tile_1. Further, tile_5 is down from tile_8, tile_3 is down from tile_6, tile_2 is down from tile_5, tile_9 is down from tile_12, tile_4 is down from tile_7, tile_7 is down from tile_10, tile_8 is down from tile_11, tile_1 is down from tile_4, and tile_6 is down from tile_9 Currently, robot robot1 is at tile_2 and holding color black and robot robot2 is at tile_6 and holding color white; tile_8, tile_1, tile_5, tile_4, tile_7, and tile_3 are clear; tile_10 is painted white, tile_11 is painted black, tile_9 is painted black, and tile_12 is painted white.
